content: Based on the fact that "The meeting was cancelled", can you construct a precisely worded, closed-ended inquiry that only elicits a binary response of either "yes" or "no"? The question must be presented in the form of an interrogative sentence in the English language, and it should require nuanced reasoning to produce the most effective inquiry.

Certainly! Here is a closed-ended question based on the fact that "The meeting was cancelled":

"Is it true that the meeting was scheduled before it was cancelled?"

This question requires nuanced reasoning because it presupposes the existence of a schedule prior to the cancellation, prompting a verification of the sequence of events.
